alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 07 at 2:49PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...NEXT ROUND OF SNOW EXPECTED WED NIGHT INTO THU... A strong storm system is expected to move north into the panhandle Wed night into Thu. This system will pull cold air west from Canada into the central and northern inner channels. Snow is expected, mainly Wed night, for most areas with accumulations ranging around 3 to 6 inches by midday Thu. High amounts of uncertainty does exist with exactly how much snow various areas will get however. Snow amounts at Petersburg, Kake, and Angoon will likely be limited by temperatures hovering around 33 to 36 for most of the event. However, if temperatures turn out colder, higher snow totals could result. Meanwhile Pelican, Hoonah, Gustavus, and Juneau snow amounts could be limited by how much liquid precipitation actually gets that far north and whether downsloping flow will be a significant factor in precipitation amounts. A significant push toward wetter or drier will likely result in more or less snowfall then what is currently expected.
